intro: Sterigmostemum caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Caspian Sea region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Sterigmostemum caspicum is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
